item.title: Projects
item.description: I have worked on a variety of projects over the years; some of them as a hobby, some as a proof of concept and others to solve my own pain points. Here are some of the projects that I have worked on.

item.title: From Heroku to Kubernetes Lessons Learned in Our Migration Journey
item.description: Migrating from Heroku to Kubernetes is no small feat. While Heroku provided a straightforward Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) environment that handled many operational aspects for us, Kubernetes offers greater flexibility, scalability, and control.

item.title: Sherlock Holmes: The Case of the Invalid HeloHost Error
item.description: This time, our debugging adventure takes us deep into the world of SMTP, where an elusive Invalid HELO error threatened to derail email sending. Let‚Äôs dive in! The Mystery Begins It was a Friday evening, and I was ready to log off and enjoy the weekend.

item.title: Automating Conversations: Building a Smart Call Agent Using Twilio and ElevenLabs
item.description: We are living in the era of AI agents, where people are increasingly developing these tools to automate mundane tasks. Today, we‚Äôll explore how to build our own call agent using Twilio and ElevenLabs.

item.title: Leading EffectiveEngineering Teams
item.description: PROJECT ARISTOTLE Google conducted one of the best-known studies on effective software engineer- ing teams, known as Project Aristotle. The project aimed to identify the factors that make some teams more successful than others.

item.title: Lessons from 2 Years of PR Reviews: 8 Costly Coding Mistakes
item.description: Hey everyone! If you‚Äôre a regular follower, you might already know a bit about me. But if not, let me quickly introduce myself: I‚Äôm a full-stack developer, and I‚Äôve been working at a startup for the past two years.
